name: Hong-feng YANG 楊宏峰
title: Assistant Professor
details:
Education:
  • Ph.D., Seismology, Saint Louis University, 2010
  • M.S., Geophysics, University of Science and Technology of China, 2004
  • B.S., Geophysics, University of Science and Technology of China, 2000
 
Academic Employments:
  • 2014 – present, Assistant Professor, The Chinese University of Hong Kong
  • 2013 – 2014, Research Scientist, Georgia Institute of Technology
  • 2010 – 2012, Postdoctoral Investigator, Woods Hole Oceanographic Institution
 
Research Fields and Current Research Interests:
  • Subduction zone dynamics and megathrust earthquakes
  • High-resolution imaging of crustal fault zones and subsurface structure
  • Earthquake detection and location
  • Earthquake source mechanics
 
Honours and Awards:
  • Nominee for the Council of Graduate Schools/ProQuest Distinguished Dissertation Award, Saint Louis University, 2012
  • Poster Presentation Prize, Graduate Research Symposium, Saint Louis University, 2010, 2008, 2007
 
Professional Activities:
Current
  • Journal reviewer for BSSA, EPSL, GRL, JGR, PAGEO, Nature Scientific Reports, and SRL
Past
  • Proposal reviewer for NSF-Earthscope, 2012, 2013
 
Selected Recent Publications:
  1. Yang, H., J. Lin, J. Yin, and H. Yao (2015), Tectonic settings of the 2015 Mw 8.3 Coquimbo, Chile earthquake and its implications on megathrust earthquakes, Chinese Sci. Bull., Vol.60, p.1-8, doi: 10.1360/N972015-01110
  2. Weng, H., J. Huang, and H. Yang* (2015), Barrier-induced supershear ruptures on a slip-weakening fault, Geophys. Res. Lett., DOI: 10.1002/2015GL064281
  3. Yang, H. (2015), Recent advances in imaging crustal fault zones: a review, Earthquake Science, doi:10.1007/s11589-015-0114-3
  4. H. Yang, Z. Li, Z. Peng, Y. Ben-Zion, and F. Vernon, Low-velocity zones along the San Jacinto Fault, Southern California, from body waves recorded in dense linear arrays, J. Geophys. Res., doi:10.1002/2014JB011548, 2014
  5. H. Yang and Z. Peng, Lack of additional triggered tectonic tremor around the Simi Valley and the San Gabriel Mountain in Southern California, Bull. Seismol. Soc. Am., 103(6), 2013
  6. H. Yang, Y. Liu, and J. Lin, Geometrical effects of a subducted seamount on stopping megathrust ruptures, Geophys. Res. Lett., VOL. 40, 1–6, doi:10.1002/grl.50509, 2013
  7. H. Yang, Y. Liu, and J. Lin, Effects of subducted seamounts on megathrust earthquake nucleation and rupture propagation, Geophys. Res. Lett., VOL. 39, L24302, doi:10.1029/2012GL053892, 2012
  8. H. Yang, L. Zhu, and E. S. Cochran, Seismic structures of the Calico fault zone inferred from local earthquake travel time modeling, Geophys. J. Int., 186(2), 760-770, doi:10.1111/j.1365-246X.2011.05055.x, 2011
  9. H. Yang, and L. Zhu, Shallow low-velocity zone of the San Jacinto fault from local earthquake waveform modeling, Geophys. J. Int., 183(1), 421-432, doi: 10.1111/j.1365-246X.2010.04744.x, 2010
  10. H. Yang, L. Zhu, and R. Chu, Fault-Plane Determination of the 18 April 2008 Mt. Carmel, Illinois, Earthquake by Detecting and Relocating Aftershocks, Bull. Seismol. Soc. Am., 99(6), 3413-3420, doi: 10.1785/0120090038, 2009
  11. H. Li, L. Zhu, and H. Yang, High-resolution structures of the Landers fault zone inferred from aftershock waveform data, Geophys. J. Int., 171(3), 1295-1307, doi:10.1111/j.1365-246X.2007.03608.x, 2007
  12. W. Xiao, J. Ren, F. Qi, Z. Song, M. Zhu, H. Yang, H. Jin, B. Wang, T. Zhou, Empirical study on clique-degree distribution of networks, Phys. Rev. E, 76(3), 037102 p1-4, doi:10.1103/PhysRevE.76.037102, 2007
 
Research Grants:
  • Investigation of characteristics and mechanism of earthquakes associated with the Hutubi gas reservoir, 01/2016-12/2019, RGC/NSFC joint scheme, co-I
  • Dynamic Controls on Megathrust Slip: Details from the Nicoya 2012 Earthquake, 2016/01-2018/12, RGC/ECS, PI
  • Detecting Low-Frequency Earthquakes within Deep Tremor in California, Z. Peng and H. Yang, 02/2014 – 01/2015, Southern California Earthquake Center
  • Pilot Investigation of the Effects of Subducted Seamount on Megathrust Earthquakes, H. Yang, Y. Liu, and J. Lin, 09/2011 – 09/2012, Deep Ocean Exploration Institute award, Woods Hole Oceanographic Institution

name: ZHANG Fan 張帆
title: Research Assistant
details:
Education:
  • Ph.D., Marine geophysics, University of Chinese Academy of Sciences, 2014
  • M.S., Marine geology, University of Chinese Academy of Sciences, 2011
  • B.S., Gemology, Chinese University of Geosciences, 2008
 
Academic Employments:
  • 2014-2015: Visiting scholar, Woods Hole Oceanographic Institution
 
Research Fields and Current Research Interests:
  • Geodynamic evolution of Earth’s oceanic lithosphere
  • Flexural bending of oceanic lithosphere
  • Active plate-boundary processes
  • Mechanisms of earthquakes and magmatic systems
 
Honours and Awards
  • Young Scientist Award, The 8th International Conference on Asian Marine Geology, 2015
  • International Ocean Discovery Program (IODP), selected as a student participant of Exp. 349, South China Sea Tectonics, 2014
  • Woods Hole Oceanographic Institution, Visiting Student, 2012-2014
  • Oversea Study Fellowship, China Scholarship Council, supporting oversea Ph.D. students, 2012-2014
 
Selected Recent Publications:
      1. Fan Zhang, Jian Lin, and Wenhuan Zhan, Variations in oceanic plate bending along the Mariana trench, Earth Planet. Sci. Lett., 206-214, doi: 10.1016/j.epsl.2014.05.032, 2014.
      2. Shaowen Wang, Wenhuan Zhan, Fan Zhang, and Junjiang Zhu, The Coulomb stress change associated with the Taiwan Strait Ms7.3 earthquake on Sep.16, 1994 and the risk prediction of its surrounding faults, Earthqu. Res. China, 27, 77-90, 2013.
      3. Fan Zhang, Wenhuan Zhan, Yan-tao Yao, Jie Sun, and Mei-zhen Zhan, Causes of coastal erosion in East Moyang River Estuary, J. Tropical Oceanogr. (in Chinese), 2, 21-27, 2012.
      4. Chun-Feng Li, Jian Lin, Denise K. Kulhanek, and the Expedition 349 Scientists (including Fan Zhang), Proceedings of the International Ocean Discovery Program (IODP), 349: South China Sea tectonics, College Station, TX (International Ocean Discovery Program), doi:10.14379/iodp.proc.349.105.2015, 2015.
      5. Chun-Feng Li, Xing Xu, Jian Lin, Zhen Sun, Jian Zhu, Yongjian Yao, Xixi Zhao, Qingsong Liu, Denise Kulhanek, Jian Wang, Taoran Song, Junfeng Zhao, Ning Qiu, Yongxian Guan, Zhiyuan Zhou, Trevor Williams, Rui Bao, Anne Briais, Elizabeth Brown, Yifeng Chen, Peter Clift, Frederick Colwell, Kelsie Dadd, Weiwei Ding, Iván Hernández-Almeida, Xiao-Long Huang, Sangmin Hyun,  Tao Jiang,  Anthony Koppers,  Qianyu Li, Chuanlian Liu, Zhifei Liu, Renata Nagai, Alyssa Peleo-Alampay, Xing Su, Maria Luisa Tejada, Hai Son Trinh, Yi-Ching Yeh, Chijun Sun, Fan Zhang, Guo-Liang Zhang, Ages and magnetic structures of the South China Sea constrained by deep tow magnetic surveys and IODP Expedition 349, Geochem. Geophys. Geosyst., doi: 10.1002/2014GC005567, 2014.
      6. Expedition 349 Scientists (including Fan Zhang), South China Sea tectonics: opening of the South China Sea and its implications for southeast Asian tectonics, climates, and deep mantle processes since the late Mesozoic, International Ocean Discovery Program Preliminary Report, 349, http://dx.doi.org/10.14379/iodp.pr.349.2014, 2014.

name: WENG Hui Hui 翁輝輝
title: Research Assistant
details:
Education:
  • Ph.D., Geophysics, University of Science and Technology of China (USTC), 2015
  • B.S., Plant Sciences,Huazhong Agricultural University (HAU), 2010
 
Academic Employments:
  • 2015 to present: Research Assistant, Earth and Space Sciences, Earth System Science Programme, Chinese University of Hong Kong (CUHK)
  • 2010 to 2015: Research Assistant, University of Science and Technology of China (USTC)
 
Research Fields and Current Research Interests:
  • Crustal fault zones structure
  • Earthquake source physics
  • Subduction zone earthquakes
  • Earthquake cycles
 
Honours and Awards
    Travel Awards:
  • Visiting Student Programme at CUHK, HongKong, Mar. 2015
  • International Summer School on Earthquake Science, Japan, Aug. 2015
    • Student Awards:
  • AEGON-INDUSTRIAL Global Responsibility Scholarship, 2014
  • Full Scholarship for Enrolled Graduate Student, 2010
 
Selected Recent Publications:
    1. Weng, H., H. Yang, Z. Zhang, and X. Chen “Earthquake ruptures promoted by damaged fault zones.” J. Geophys. Res., under revision
    2. Yin, J., H. Yang, H. Yao and H. Weng “Coseismic radiation and stress drop during the 2015 Mw8.3 Illapel, Chile megathrust earthquake.” Geophys. Res. Lett., under revision
    3. Weng, H., J. Huang, and H. Yang “Barrier-induced supershear ruptures on a slip-weakening fault.” Geophys. Res. Lett., 42(12): 4824-4832, 2015
    4. Weng, H. and J. Huang “Numerical simulations about the influence of stress disturbance on earthquake cycle and seismic moment.” Acta Seismologica Sinica (in Chinese), 37(1): 65-79, 2015
    5. Weng, H. and J. Huang “Numerical simulations about subduction earthquake cycles: The case of Japan Tohoku Mw9.0 earthquake.” Journal of Geodesy and Geodynamics (in Chinese), 2015
    6. Diao, F., X. Xiong, R. Wang, Y. Zheng, T. R. Walter, H. Weng, and J. Li “Overlapping post-seismic deformation processes: afterslip and viscoelastic relaxation following the 2011 Mw 9.0 Tohoku (Japan) earthquake.” Geophysical Journal International, 196(1), 218-229, 2014
    7. Yang, A., H. Weng, and J. Huang “Numerical studies on the effects of phase transitions on Venusian mantle convection.” Science China: Earth Sciences, 1-12, 2015
